results.title: Water on the land
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Part 4 of a 4 part series, each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing and uses a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This program looks at the water cycle; glaciated landscapes; river erosion - V-shaped valleys and waterfalls; meanders; oxbow lakes; and flood plains. Includes a teacher’s guide.

results.title: Weather & climate - precipitation
results.creator_credit: Ian Rosenbloom, European Broadcasting Union and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Program 3 of a 4 part series. Each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics, and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This video aims to provide a detailed description and explanation of water in various forms: types of rainfall; prevailing winds; anticyclones; tropical storms and predicting the weather. Includes a teacher’s guide.

results.title: Weather & climate : temperature
results.creator_credit: Ian Rosenbloom, European Broadcasting Union and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Program 2 of a 4 part series. Each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This video aims to provide a detailed description and explanation of temperature. In particular it covers the ares of: the Earth’s axis; day and night; latitude; aspect and altitude; ocean currents; prevailing winds; cloud cover and atmosphere, as well a contextual overview of the solar system. Includes a teacher’s guide.

results.title: Tectonics
results.creator_credit: Ian Rosenbloom, European Broadcasting Union and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Program 1 of a 4 part series. Each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This video aims to provide a detailed description and explanation of the structure of the earth; plate tectonics; earthquakes at destructive and conservative margins; collision zones; fold mountains; and volcanoes. Includes a teacher’s guide.

results.title: Jules Verne's mysterious island; Marco Polo
results.creator_credit: Leif Gram, Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storytime Collection”.
Features two classic children’s stories; JULES VERNE’S MYSTERIOUS ISLAND; five prisoners flee the American Civil War in a hot air balloon. They land on a mysterious island, blown by the storm winds across the Pacific Ocean. What is the cause of the inexplicable events that occur on the island and will the five prisoners live to find out? MARCO POLO; set in China in the year 1260, this animated production is based on the original Marco Polo journals. Marco Polo and his servant Ton-Ton travel from Venice to China on a mission to find the Kubla Khan.
